what: Report Card Marks to Achievement Levels
title: Recoding Report Card Marks
code: ele_rc |>    mutate (reading_levels = obt_recode_rc_to_levels(reading)) |>    select (school, id, reading, reading_levels) |>    slice_sample(n = 10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 4 #>    school                            id reading reading_levels #>    <chr>                          <int> <chr>   <chr>          #>  1 Degrassi Community School     298582 B       Level 3        #>  2 Watkins Middle School         247709 I       NE1            #>  3 Degrassi Community School     207361 D+      Level 1        #>  4 Southpark Elementary School   419451 B       Level 3        #>  5 Southpark Elementary School   242838 91      Level 4        #>  6 Shelbyville Elementary School 435252 B+      Level 3        #>  7 Southpark Elementary School   490236 58      Level 1        #>  8 Degrassi Community School     401372 70      Level 3        #>  9 Springfield Elementary School 329622 72      Level 3        #> 10 Springfield Elementary School 387849 A-      Level 4

what: Report Card Marks to Met Standard / Did Not Meet Standard
title: Recoding Report Card Marks
code: sec_rc |>    mutate (final_ps = obt_recode_rc_L34(final)) |>    select (school, id, course_number, final, final_ps)|>    slice_sample(n = 10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 5 #>    school                  id course_number final final_ps              #>    <chr>                <int> <chr>         <chr> <chr>                 #>  1 Shermer High School 569040 SCH3U         67    did_not_meet_standard #>  2 Degrassi High       855590 MPM2D         78    met_standard          #>  3 Shermer High School 666333 KPFDN         AL    AL                    #>  4 Shermer High School 740592 KBBFN         0     did_not_meet_standard #>  5 Degrassi High       962247 TCC4E         75    met_standard          #>  6 Ridgemont HS        636773 ENG3C         64    did_not_meet_standard #>  7 Shermer High School 762718 SNC2P         61    did_not_meet_standard #>  8 Shermer High School 643956 TCC3E         50    did_not_meet_standard #>  9 Shermer High School 994402 MCV4U         70    met_standard          #> 10 Ridgemont HS        802245 SPH4U         92    met_standard

what: Report Card Marks to Pass Fail
title: Recoding Report Card Marks
text: Results traditional alpha/numeric mark remain . example ALT (alternative education), (Insufficent) NA (missing data).
code: ele_rc |>    mutate (read_pass_fail = obt_recode_rc_pass_fail(reading)) |>    select (school, id, reading, read_pass_fail)|>    arrange (read_pass_fail) |>    group_by (read_pass_fail) |>    slice_sample(n = 2) #> # A tibble: 10 × 4 #> # Groups:   read_pass_fail [5] #>    school                            id reading read_pass_fail #>    <chr>                          <int> <chr>   <chr>          #>  1 Shelbyville Elementary School 505833 ALT     ALT            #>  2 Watkins Middle School         125547 ALT     ALT            #>  3 Degrassi Community School     361151 R       fail           #>  4 Springfield Elementary School 489112 R       fail           #>  5 Shelbyville Elementary School 331883 I       I              #>  6 Springfield Elementary School 375981 I       I              #>  7 Southpark Elementary School   213461 62      pass           #>  8 Degrassi Community School     347611 A       pass           #>  9 Shelbyville Elementary School 117376 NA      NA             #> 10 Watkins Middle School         396929 NA      NA

title: Recoding Report Card Marks
text: function take column contains alpha grades, combination alpha numeric grades, convert alpha grades numeric equivalent. NOTE - may produce warning message: NAs introduced coercion. means non-standard alpha mark converted NA. + = 90 = 85” - = 80 B+ = 78 B = 75 B- = 72” C+ = 68 C = 65 C- = 62 D+ = 58 D = 55 D- = 52 D- = 52 R = 45 else = NA
code: set.seed (168)  ele_rc |>    mutate (math_numeric = obt_recode_letter_percent(mathematics)) |>    select (school, id, mathematics, math_numeric) |>    slice_sample(n = 10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 4 #>    school                            id mathematics math_numeric #>    <chr>                          <int> <chr>              <dbl> #>  1 Shelbyville Elementary School 141128 C+                    68 #>  2 Shelbyville Elementary School 251837 73                    73 #>  3 Watkins Middle School         527509 B+                    78 #>  4 Springfield Elementary School 337938 78                    78 #>  5 Shelbyville Elementary School 552172 78                    78 #>  6 Southpark Elementary School   309292 A-                    80 #>  7 Shelbyville Elementary School 333046 50                    50 #>  8 Watkins Middle School         211346 C+                    68 #>  9 Watkins Middle School         343537 A-                    80 #> 10 Springfield Elementary School 530202 C-                    62

what: Recoding Course Number to Level of Study
title: Secondary Courses to Level of Study
text: function takes fifth digit course number (ENG2D, FSF3U) creates vector level study. L = Locally Developed P = Applied D = Academic E = Workplace C = College U = University O = Open M = University/College N = Alternative Education W = De-streamed
code: set.seed (325) sec_rc |>    select (id, course_number) |>    mutate (level_study = obt_sec_level_study(course_number)) |>    slice_sample (n = 10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>        id course_number level_study        #>     <int> <chr>         <chr>              #>  1 824079 SNC1D         Academic           #>  2 969169 AVI2OF        Open               #>  3 809554 SCH3U         University         #>  4 833526 TGJ4M         University/College #>  5 791443 SNC1DL        Academic           #>  6 864275 MAT1L         Locally Developed  #>  7 713483 TDJ2O         Open               #>  8 783411 ENG2DA        Academic           #>  9 667311 SPH3U         University         #> 10 956068 MFM1P         Applied

title: Summary Table
code: library(obt) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) df <- ele_rc  df |>    obt_summary_table(school) #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #>   school                            n  perc #>   <chr>                         <int> <dbl> #> 1 Degrassi Community School       516 0.206 #> 2 Shelbyville Elementary School   763 0.305 #> 3 Southpark Elementary School     326 0.130 #> 4 Springfield Elementary School   489 0.196 #> 5 Watkins Middle School           406 0.162

title: Summary Table
code: df |>    obt_summary_table(school) |>    ggplot (aes (x = school, y = perc)) +    geom_col (fill = "#bcc4d7") +    scale_x_discrete(label = scales::wrap_format(10)) +    scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(),                       limits = c(0, 1)) +    geom_text (aes (label = scales::percent(perc)),               vjust = -1) +    labs (title = "Percentage of Students by Elementary Schools",          x = NULL,          y = "Percent") +    theme_minimal()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rousell Greg. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Greg R (2022). obt: Functions Ontario School Board data professionals. https://github.com/grousell/obt, https://grousell.github.io/obt/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {obt: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals},   author = {Rousell Greg},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/grousell/obt, https://grousell.github.io/obt/}, }

what: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals
title: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals
text: goal Ontario Board Tools obt package provide tools data professionals Ontario school boards (elsewhere) work common data sets across province. includes: Report Card Data (elementary secondary) EQAO Data (Primary Junior assessments Reading, Writing Mathematics, Grade 9 Assessments Mathematics Ontario Secondary School Literacy Test) (pending) Ontario University Application Center (OUAC) Ontario College Application Service (OCAS) data (pending) Features package include re-coding report card marks Ontario achievement levels /Standard (e.e Level 3 Level 4) Pass/Fail Alpha marks numeric equivalent (.e. = 90, B- = 72, D = 55)

title: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals
text: can install development version obt GitHub :

what: Fictional Report Card Data - Elementary — ele_rc
title: Fictional Report Card Data - Elementary — ele_rc
text: Fictional data Elementary Report Card Marks

title: Fictional Report Card Data - Elementary — ele_rc
Fictional Report Card Data - Elementary — ele_rc
text: dataframe 2500 rows 16 variables id Unique student identifier school School student enrolled grade Grade student responsibility Learning Skill - Responsibility initiative Learning Skill - Initiative independent_work Learning Skill - Independent Work organization Learning Skill - Organization collaboration Learning Skill - Collaboration self_regulation Learning Skill - Self Regulation reading Final Mark - Reading writing Final Mark - Writing mathematics Final Mark - Mathematics science_and_technology Final Mark - Science Technology social_studies Final Mark - Social Studies history Final Mark - History geography Final Mark - Geography

what: obt: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals — obt-package
title: obt: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals — obt-package
text: obt (Ontario Board Tools) collection functions data professionals working Ontario school boards. functions designed assist working common data sets across province, Report Card, EQAO, OUAC, OCAS others.

title: obt: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals — obt-package
text: Maintainer: Rousell Greg grousell@gmail.com

title: Recode Letter to Percent — obt_recode_letter_percent
text: function recode alpha report card marks (, B-, D+) Numeric values.

title: Recode Letter to Percent — obt_recode_letter_percent
text: x vector report card marks containing alpha marks, combination alpha mumeric marks.

title: Recode Letter to Percent — obt_recode_letter_percent
text: Numeric vector

what: Recode Report Card marks to Met Standard / Did not Meet Standard — obt_recode_rc_L34
title: Recode Report Card marks to Met Standard / Did not Meet Standard — obt_recode_rc_L34
text: Recode Report Card marks Met Standard / Meet Standard

title: Recode Report Card marks to Met Standard / Did not Meet Standard — obt_recode_rc_L34
Recode Report Card marks to Met Standard / Did not Meet Standard — obt_recode_rc_L34
text: x Vector report card marks. Can either alpha (C+, B-, ) numeric (88, 63, 79)

title: Recode Report Card marks to Met Standard / Did not Meet Standard — obt_recode_rc_L34
text: Character vector Met Standard / Meet Standard

what: Recode Report Card marks to Pass/Fail — obt_recode_rc_pass_fail
title: Recode Report Card marks to Pass/Fail — obt_recode_rc_pass_fail

title: Recode Report Card marks to Pass/Fail — obt_recode_rc_pass_fail
Recode Report Card marks to Pass/Fail — obt_recode_rc_pass_fail
text: x Vector report card marks. Can either alpha (C+, B-, ) numeric (88, 63, 79)

text: Character vector Pass/Fail

what: Recode Report Card Marks to Achievement Levels — obt_recode_rc_to_levels
title: Recode Report Card Marks to Achievement Levels — obt_recode_rc_to_levels
text: function takes report card marks, alpha (+, B, C-, etc.) numeric (68, 72, 86, etc.) converts achievement levels used Ontario school boards

title: Recode Report Card Marks to Achievement Levels — obt_recode_rc_to_levels
Recode Report Card Marks to Achievement Levels — obt_recode_rc_to_levels
text: x Vector report card marks. Can either alpha (C+, B-, ) numeric (88, 63, 79)

title: Recode Report Card Marks to Achievement Levels — obt_recode_rc_to_levels
text: Character vector achievement levels (NE1, Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, Level 4)

title: Secondary Level of Study — obt_sec_level_study
text: function re-code Ontario secondary courses Level Study (Academic, Applied, University, College, Open etc.)

title: Secondary Level of Study — obt_sec_level_study
text: x vector containing Ontario secondary course code least first five digits (e.g. ENG2D, FSF3U, SNC1L)

title: Secondary Level of Study — obt_sec_level_study
text: vector containing course level associated course code (e.g. ENG2D = Academic, FSF3U = University)

title: Summary Table — obt_summary_table
text: Given dataframe tibble, returns tibble counts percentages group. Can single group, group 2 can nested within group 1

title: Summary Table — obt_summary_table
text: df Dataframe tibble group_1 First grouping variable group_2 Second grouping variable (optional)

title: Summary Table — obt_summary_table
text: tibble counts percentages group
